content.description: Sit start and slap up some slopers to a mellow finish.
content.protection: A single pad will do just fine
content.location: The obvious, short, rounded arete on the left-side of the Amphitheater boulder

content.description: Right problem of the two Tweedles, start in the pods/sidepulls just left of a crack. Go for the crack directly or add an extra move using a nice sidepull a bit above the start; follow crack to top. Good beginner problem.
content.location:
In the small corridor just before Pimpsqueak; right of the two taller cracks in boulder.

Full approach details available here:

mountainproject.com/approac…

content.description: Left problem of the two Tweedles, grab the large jug about 6 ft up next to a crack and follow crack to top. Can also sit start if you want some extra hand jams or long reach for the ledge. Good beginner problem.
content.location:
In the small corridor just before Pimpsqueak; crack with the large jug/ledge half way up.

Full approach details available here:

mountainproject.com/approac…

content.description: A fun traverse, all on good holds. Start right and Traverse left. End at the tree, top out up the dirty slab, or traverse all the way around the corner.
content.location: A few steps down from Amphitheater, near Pimpsqueak.

content.description: Climb the left trending crack on the short face.
content.location: Halfway through the trail to Pimpsqueak, diverge right down a stepped slab to the short face.

content.description:
Start on the two chest-high pods on the right side of this secluded scooped face. Climb to a teensy crimp, then bust to the flat ledge above and mantle.

Variation, V0: From pods, bump right to arete and move up nice pinches until you can reach the flat ledge to top out (can also hand traverse over to finish up Crank if mantling isn't your jam)
content.location: West and down hill of the Pimpsqueak boulder.
